title: Bitcoin Hits 17-Day High, Avalanche Posts Double-Digit Gains (Market Watch)
body: Bitcoin’s positive price movements that started on Sunday evening continued in the following hours, and the asset tapped $87,600 for the first time since March 7. The altcoins have followed suit, led by AVAX’s impressive surge. In contrast, Pi Network’s PI token continues to bleed out. BTC Reclaims $87K The previous business week was quite eventful in terms of news, but not so much when it comes down to BTC price movements. The most volatile day turned out to be Wednesday, which was expected to an extent as the US Fed concluded its second meeting for the year. Although it refused to change the interest rates, bitcoin went on the move by going up and down by a few grand within hours. The fluctuations were also influenced by the statement from Ripple’s CEO, Brad Garlinghouse, that the SEC would drop its lawsuit against his company. BTC flew to $87,500 during the Thursday morning Asian trading session but was quickly halted and pushed south by several grand. Nevertheless, it recovered most of the lost ground and returned to $84,000, where it spent most of the weekend. It went on the offensive late last night but kept climbing earlier today and surpassed $87,000. It even briefly tapped $87,600 (on Bitstamp) for the first time in over two weeks. Although it has retraced slightly since then, BTC still trades above $87,000. Its market cap has jumped to $1.730 trillion on CG, while its dominance over the alts is up to 58.5%. BTCUSD. Source: TradingView AVAX Runs Wild As mentioned above, most alts are well in the green today. Ethereum is close to $2,100 after a 3.5% daily surge, XRP has surpassed $2.45 following a similar increase, while SOL, LINK, and SUI have marked gains of somewhere between 5-7%. Avalanche has stolen the show, though, charting a substantial 12% surge in the past day. As a result, AVAX has neared $22 for the first time in weeks. In contrast, PI continues to bleed out, dumping by another 6% in the past 24 hours to well below $1. The total crypto market cap has added around $80 billion since yesterday and is up to $2.960 trillion on CG. Cryptocurrency Market Overview. Source: QuantifyCrypto The post Bitcoin Hits 17-Day High, Avalanche Posts Double-Digit Gains (Market Watch) appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Japanese Investment Firm Metaplanet Bought Bitcoin Again After Eric Trump Appointed As Advisor! Here Are The Details
body: Japanese investment firm Metaplanet has added 150 BTC worth approximately $12.6 million to its growing Bitcoin treasury as it continues its aggressive accumulation strategy. Metaplanet Bought $12.6 Million in Bitcoin After Eric Trump Appointed as Advisor The latest purchase, made at an average price of $83,801 per BTC, brought Metaplanet’s total assets to 3,350 BTC purchased for $278.8 million. At current market prices, the firm’s Bitcoin holdings are worth approximately $291.3 million. Eric Trump Joins as Strategic Advisor The company's latest Bitcoin purchase comes just days after Donald Trump's second son, Eric Trump, was appointed to Metaplanet's Board of Strategic Advisors. CEO Simon Gerovich noted that Eric Trump’s “business expertise and passion for BTC” will help Metaplanet advance its goal of becoming one of the world’s leading Bitcoin Treasury Companies. Metaplanet's Bitcoin Strategy Metaplanet, Nisan 2024’te Bitcoin benimseme stratejisini başlattığından beri BTC varlıklarını istikrarlı bir şekilde artırıyor. Firma, 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 elde etmeyi amaçlayan iddialı hedefler belirlemiştir: 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 21,000 BTC by the end of 2026 According to Bitcointreasuries.net, Metaplanet is currently the 10th largest publicly traded Bitcoin holder and the largest in Asia. Meanwhile, Michael Saylor’s Strategy maintains its global lead, holding around 500,000 BTC. Stock Performance and Market Impact Metaplanet’s shares rose 4.8% in the afternoon trading session in Japan following the announcement. The stock is up 38.7% year-to-date, reflecting growing investor confidence in the firm’s Bitcoin-focused strategy. *This is not investment advice. title: TEAMZ Summit 2025 Official Agenda Announced – Key Sessions on the Future of Web3 & AI Confirmed
body: The official agenda for TEAMZ Summit 2025, taking place on April 16-17, 2025, at Toranomon Hills International Forum, has been released. As Japan’s largest Web3 & AI conference, this event will bring together government officials, major corporations, startups, investors, developers, and the Web3 community to discuss the future of next-generation technologies. This article highlights must-attend sessions and speakers. April 16, 2025 11:00-12:00 The New Economic System and Social Future Created by Web3 & AI Industry leaders will discuss the new economic system enabled by the convergence of AI and blockchain, with an in-depth look at Japan’s Web3 policies and corporate initiatives. Speakers Takuya Hirai (Liberal Democratic Party Public Relations Headquarters Chief, Digital Society Promotion Headquarters Chief) Yuzo Kano (bitFlyer CEO) Genki Oda (Chairman, Japan Virtual and Crypto Assets Exchange Association (JVCEA), Executive Officer, SBI Holdings) Yusuke Otsuka (Executive Officer CBDO, Coincheck, Inc.) Jun Watanabe (Chairman, SONY BLOCK SOLUTIONS LABS PTE.LTD.) 13:15-13:45 The Frontline of Web3 & AI Investment – Opportunities and Challenges in Next-Gen Technology This session will explore investment trends in Web3 & AI, key characteristics of projects that attract investors, and insights from leading VCs and startup founders driving technological innovation. Speakers James Wo (Founder & CEO, DFG) Ryo Umezawa (Head of New Business Development & Overseas M&A, VECTOR) Aly Madhavji (Managing Partner, Blockchain Founders Fund) Akio Tanaka (Partner, Infinity Ventures Crypto) Lloyd Lee (CEO, HYPERITHM) April 17, 2025 10:45-11:15 Strategies of Major Corporations for the Future of Web3 – Adoption and Challenges How are major corporations shaping their Web3 strategies? This panel will explore blockchain and AI-driven new business models and the talent recruitment challenges companies face in this space. Speakers Kano Kanamori (Customer Experience and CX Strategy Promotion, Sony Bank) Shunpei Tatebayashi (Web3 Promotion Director, KDDI Corporation) Takuma Murata (Web3 Business Development Officer, GREE Holdings) Yasuhiro Sasaki (CIO & Executive Officer, Rakuten Wallet) Akira Masuzawa (Advanced Content Business Co-Director, TV ASAHI) 13:00-13:45 The Future of Stablecoins in Japan and Global Competitiveness This panel will explore the current regulatory landscape for stablecoins in Japan, their competitiveness in the global market, and how financial institutions and stablecoin-related companies are approaching this evolving sector. Speakers Hideki Ikeda (Executive Officer CTO, SBI VC TRADE) Yoshio Mikado (President, Osaka Digital Exchange) Ken Kodama (Group CEO, EMURGO) Yosuke Shiraishi (Co-Founder, DECIMA Fund / Vice Chairman, JCBA) Kentaro Nakamura (CEO, GMO-Z.COM TRUST COMPANY, INC.) Gen Adachi (CFO, Netstars, Inc.) 15:00-16:00 The New Economic System and Social Future Created by Web3 & AI Politicians, business leaders, and investors will discuss the potential of Web3 and AI, how technological innovations will reshape society, and their impact on Japan’s economic growth. Speakers Hideto Kawasaki (Parliamentary Vice Minister for Internal Affairs and Communications, Liberal Democratic Party) Toru Hashimoto (Former Governor of Osaka, Former Mayor of Osaka) Takafumi Horie (Entrepreneur) Yuta Misaki (Entrepreneur, Influencer) Hironobu Kunimitsu (CEO, Financie) 16:00-16:45 Japan’s Position in the Global Web3 & AI Competition – Policies and Support Strategies This panel will explore Japan’s role in the international Web3 and AI landscape, discussing government policies, regulatory measures, and corporate initiatives to enhance Japan’s competitiveness. Speakers Yuichiro Tamaki (Representative of the Democratic Party for the People, Member of the House of Representatives) Genki Oda (Chairman, Japan Virtual and Crypto Assets Exchange Association (JVCEA), Executive Officer, SBI Holdings) Yusuke Shitara (Editor-in-Chief, Atarashii Keizai) TEAMZ Summit 2025 is not only a premier venue for learning about the latest Web3 and AI developments but also an unparalleled opportunity to network directly with industry leaders from Japan and around the world. Gain insights into cutting-edge technologies, regulatory trends, and business opportunities. Event Dates : April 16-17, 2025 Venue : Toranomon Hills International Forum, Tokyo Ticket Purchase : https://web3.teamz.co.jp/tickets-list-2025 Summit Agenda Details April 16 Agenda : https://web3.teamz.co.jp/teamz-summit-2025-agenda-april-16 April 17 Agenda : https://web3.teamz.co.jp/teamz-summit-2025-agenda-april-17 Let’s shape the future of Web3 & AI together!

title: Pi Network News: SuperNode Controversy Sparks Decentralization Debate
body: The post Pi Network News: SuperNode Controversy Sparks Decentralization Debate appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Pi Network is struggling with multiple challenges, from KYC problems to declining user interest the market sentiment towards Pi is fading. Adding to the woes, the Pi Network has seen its price dip below the crucial $1 mark from its all-time high of $3, leaving many Pioneers questioning its long-term potential. Despite efforts to expand the ecosystem with projects like PiDaoSwap and the launch of .pi domains, concerns over the network’s structure have overshadowed its progress. Now, fresh scrutiny over its SuperNodes has sparked debate over whether Pi Network is truly decentralized or just another centralized system in disguise. SuperNodes: A Centralization Problem? Pi Network claims to be a decentralized, community-driven project, but in reality, its core team (PCT) controls the SuperNodes that validate transactions. Unlike Bitcoin or Ethereum, where thousands of independent nodes secure the network, Pi’s system remains tightly managed. Initially, only three SuperNodes existed, all controlled by PCT in Canada and Finland. While the number has now grown to 42 as per Piscan.io , there’s little transparency. The team hasn’t shared a list of these SuperNodes or explained how they are selected, leaving many Pioneers confused about the process. Community Frustration Reaches Boiling Point However with the recent price drop, KYC details, controversy over its claims of decentralization. Many Pioneers are growing frustrated with the lack of rewards and participation opportunities. A Reddit post asking, “What is a SuperNode?” received vague responses from the team, only detailing their technical role without clarifying how one could become a SuperNode. On the other side, regular Pioneers who have been running nodes for months report no progress or rewards, further fueling skepticism. Some fear that only a select group with insider knowledge or powerful hardware can qualify, contradicting Pi Network’s vision of making crypto accessible to all. If participation is restricted, then is Pi Network really as decentralized as it claims to be? Whom to Blame? Meanwhile, the Pi Network Core Team reassured users that they are working hard behind the scenes to give Pi the value it deserves. They blamed the price drop on Pioneers who are only selling Pi instead of buying. According to them, once people start buying, the price will surge. Is Pi Network a Scam? Crypto analyst Justin Bons, Founder & CIO of Cyber Capital, has openly called Pi Network a scam. He pointed out flaws in its technology, tokenomics, and centralization, arguing that Pi relies heavily on Stellar’s technology and lacks true decentralized finance (DeFi) potential. Bons also criticized its mining model, likening it to a Ponzi scheme. For Pi Network to regain trust, PCT must address these concerns by making the SuperNode selection process transparent, publishing a list of approved nodes, and ensuring fair rewards for participants. Until then, doubts will continue to overshadow Pi’s vision, and its price may struggle to recover.
